description: First attested 1656, from French bouillon, from the verb bouillir (“to boil”), from Old French boillir, from Latin bullīre, present active infinitive of bulliō (“I bubble, boil”), from bulla (“bubble”).

entries.meaning: A clear seasoned broth made by simmering usually light meat, such as beef or chicken.
An excrescence on a horse's frush or frog.
